description: Coined by Ross Jeffries, after his cat Sarge.

verbs.description: sarge (third-person singular simple present sarges, present participle sarging, simple past and past participle sarged)

entries.meaning: (seduction community) to go out and engage women in order to pick them up
examples: Jeffries pioneered the coinage of distinctive seduction lingo—his most widely used neologism: “sarging,” named after his cat Sarge and meaning trolling the bars for desirable women—as well as the use of the Internet.
